Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2013 04:03PM algranna wrote: allebasi....I had my surgery on 10/28 and I did not feel like doing anything for a couple of weeks. I just started driving this week. I still have very low energy and tire easily. My surgery was on a Monday. Came home on Wedsesday and was told I could shower on Thursday. I still had four drains. I have heard people say they wrap saran wrap around their chest to shower. I do not understand why some doctors say you can shower and others say no. Mine told me I could take tubs baths also, which I did today. Regarding my appetite, I have not had one since my surgery. I make my self eat two meals everyday. Happy Sunday to everyone!

I was told today that I should not turn red for a couple of weeks.   Good luck to everyone and Happy Hump Day!

Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: algranna wrote: I was diagnosed with breast cancer about 5 weeks ago.  The mass is over 5 cm and they can not do surgery until I have chemo and the mass shrinks.  I had a port put in two weeks ago today and 4 lymph nodes biopsied of which 3 were positive.  I had fluid build up last Thursday and they needle removed 60 cc's.  Today I went back and they removed 106 cc's of fluid.  He told me to come back on Monday and if the fluid is still collecting he will open the incision up and put a drain tube in.  I was to start chemo last week now it is delayed until the fluid stops. I am very discouraged.  I feel like the cancer is growing daily.  If I have the drain tube put in then I will have to wait on that incision to heal before I can start treatment.  Has any one else had this problem? Dx 3/18/2013, 5cm, Stage IIIA, 3/4 nodes Chemotherapy 5/8/2013 AC + T (Taxol) Surgery 10/27/2013 Mastectomy: Left, Right Surgery 1/12/2014 Reconstruction (left); Reconstruction (right) Radiation Therapy Breast, Lymph nodes Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Fluid build up under arm algranna algranna

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2013 03:16PM algranna wrote: I had surgery on Monday. A radical masectomy on the right and a simple masectomy on the left. They only removed 3 lymph nodes on the right and two on the left. When they got in there they could not see any cancer at all. They said the lymph nodes on the right were tangled and had scar tissue so they decided to not remove them. I should here from the pathology report soon. If there is cancer in the tissue they took out, then they will go back in and remove the lymph nodes. I have four drains. I feel great! Came home yesterday. Got a shower today. I am able to use my arms. I pray all of you are doing well.
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie
